intro: Pleurospermum albimarginatum, commonly known as the white-margin tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features upright, branched stems covered in fine hairs and lance-shaped leaves with a silvery-white margin. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in flat-topped clusters, attracting various pollinators. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a suitable addition to rock gardens and dry landscapes.
